# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(9, 9)],
    positions: Annotated[list[X_Y_Position], Len(9, 9)],
    assignments: Annotated[list[int], Len(9, 9)],
    nr_boxes: int
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
        box_id: int = assignments[i]

        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item is placed within valid box coordinates
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

        # Ensure box assignment is valid
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= nr_boxes

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)# -- Constraints --


# --- Incorrect Code ---
def no_overlap(
    positions: Annotated[list[X_Y_Position], Len(9, 9)],
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(9, 9)],
    assignments: Annotated[list[int], Len(9, 9)]
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        for j in range(i + 1, 10):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                pos_i: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
                pos_j: X_Y_Position = positions[j]
                item_i: Item = items[i]
                item_j: Item = items[j]

                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap (i.e., rectangles do not overlap)
                assert pos_i.x >= pos_j.x + item_j.width or pos_j.x >= pos_i.x + item_i.width or pos_i.y >= pos_j.y + item_j.height or pos_j.y >= pos_i.y + item_i.height

no_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS, item_box_assignments)# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

# --- Constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: Annotated[list[int], Len(9, 9)],
    nr_boxes: int
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= nr_boxes

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

def ensure_position_bounds(
    positions: Annotated[list[X_Y_Position], Len(9, 9)],
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(9, 9)]
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        pos: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
        item: Item = items[i]
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_position_bounds(x_y_positions, ITEMS)

def prevent_item_overlap(
    positions: Annotated[list[X_Y_Position], Len(9, 9)],
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(9, 9)],
    assignments: Annotated[list[int], Len(9, 9)]
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        for j in range(i + 1, 10):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                pos_i: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
                pos_j: X_Y_Position = positions[j]
                item_i: Item = items[i]
                item_j: Item = items[j]
                assert pos_i.x >= pos_j.x + item_j.width or pos_j.x >= pos_i.x + item_i.width or pos_i.y >= pos_j.y + item_j.height or pos_j.y >= pos_i.y + item_i.height

prevent_item_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

nr_used_boxes = objective
partial_formulation_up_until_now:
Item = DSRecord({"width" : DSInt(lb=1, ub=10), "height" : DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)})
X_Y_Position = DSRecord({"x" : DSInt(lb=0, ub=12), "y" : DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 5
BOX_WIDTH : int = 12
ITEMS : DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item) = [{'name': 'item1', 'width': 4, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item2', 'width': 1, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item3', 'width': 5, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item4', 'width': 4, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item5', 'width': 1, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item6', 'width': 5, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item7', 'width': 9, 'height': 5}, {'name': 'item8', 'width': 3, 'height': 5}, {'name': 'item9', 'width': 5, 'height': 1}]
N_ITEMS : int = 9
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9))
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 9
x_y_positions : DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 9
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 9
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 9


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())) -> int:
    max_box = 0
    for i in range(1, 10):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

calculated_objective_value = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
objective = calculated_objective_value

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt()),
    nr_boxes: int
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
        box_id: int = assignments[i]

        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item is placed within valid box coordinates
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

        # Ensure box assignment is valid
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= nr_boxes

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

# --- Incorrect Code ---
def no_overlap(
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        for j in range(i + 1, 10):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                pos_i: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
                pos_j: X_Y_Position = positions[j]
                item_i: Item = items[i]
                item_j: Item = items[j]

                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap (i.e., rectangles do not overlap)
                assert pos_i.x >= pos_j.x + item_j.width or pos_j.x >= pos_i.x + item_i.width or pos_i.y >= pos_j.y + item_j.height or pos_j.y >= pos_i.y + item_i.height

no_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

def ensure_position_bounds(
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        pos: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
        item: Item = items[i]
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_position_bounds(x_y_positions, ITEMS)

def prevent_item_overlap(
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())
):
    for i in range(1, 10):
        for j in range(i + 1, 10):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                pos_i: X_Y_Position = positions[i]
                pos_j: X_Y_Position = positions[j]
                item_i: Item = items[i]
                item_j: Item = items[j]
                assert pos_i.x >= pos_j.x + item_j.width or pos_j.x >= pos_i.x + item_i.width or pos_i.y >= pos_j.y + item_j.height or pos_j.y >= pos_i.y + item_i.height

prevent_item_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

nr_used_boxes = objective
